item.title: Tree which was cut down by the council or a contractor on behalf of the council the large stump is bent over and needs totally removing and paving stones repaired, 8th October
item.description:
Tree pruned by the council in Salisbury road earlier this year- large stump was left and is bent over- whole thing needs removing- dangerous and cars could hit it when parking. Paving slabs should be repaired once the stump has been removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive graffiti on Bus Shelter, 8th October
item.description:
There are two amounts of red offensively political slogans worn in the information boards of the Bus stop on Green Lanes opposite Rowley Gardens estate. Please can it be cleaned off as a matter of property - thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: Overgrowing edge/tree on the canal, 8th October
item.description:
Overgrown vegetation blocking the canal path. It’s dangerous for pedestrians and cyclists, and not safe at all during nighttime. Please work with the Canal & River Trust to resolve this issue. Thank you for your attention to this matter

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunston Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Someone has left a mattress outside this house, 8th October
item.description:
Hello, Someone has left this mattress outside this house. It’s been here for almost a week. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Ongoing Grass Cutting Issue. Incomplete Verge Maintenance, 8th October
item.description:
Grass to the side of flats Ivychurch Close. The grass on the front verge is being cut, but the narrower side verge is consistently being left untouched due to the contractors using large seated mowers that can't access it. This in turn attracts the dumping of rubbish in the uncut areas. This issue has been reported multiple times since last year. Each time, a follow up team eventually comes with the correct equipment, but only after a report is made. Can this be addressed properly going forward, with the correct equipment brought in the first instance to cut all areas, not just the easily accessible ones

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Laurel Grove, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous corns/fruits from tree, 8th October
item.description:
This is the only tree on eden way to be causing dangerous footing with corns/fruits fallen on the floor. Request this tree is replaced with a non-fruit bearing tree as this is a trip / slipping hazard that has caused myself and neighbours issues

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Way, Eden Park, London

item.title: Mountbatten Close SE19 back of Fu Mi takeaway, 8th October
item.description:
